tit.e: Haitei no Yashiro shrine (Shrine of Dethroned Emperor)
Haitei no Yashiro Shrine (Shrine of the Dethroned Emperor)
Haitei no Yashiro Shrine (Shrine of the Dethroned Emperor)

sen.j: 廃帝社（はいていのやしろ）は、京都府京都市下京区の円丘の上にあった社である。
sen.e: Haitei no Yashiro shrine was a shrine that was located on the knoll in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Haitei no Yashiro Shrine is located on a knoll in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Shrine"; eliminated "was a shrine that"; changed "was" to "is"; changed "the knoll" to "a knoll";
sen.e: Haitei no Yashiro Shrine was located on a knoll in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Summery
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 同地は稲荷に通じる伏見街道の東側に当たり、小さい祠が2つ南面している。
sen.e: The premisis was in the east side of Fushimi Kaido Road and there were two small shrines face to the south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The shrine is on the east side of Fushimi Kaido Road with two small shrines facing south.
The shrine is on the east side of Fushimi Kaido Road leading to Inari with two small shrines facing south.

sen.j: 1つは淳仁天皇、舎人親王、早良親王を、1つは神功皇后、井上皇后、他戸親王を祀ったという。
sen.e: It is said, one shrined enshrines Emperor Junnin, Imperial Prince Toneri and Imperial Prince Sawara and the other enshrined Empress Jingu, Empress Inoue and Imperial Prince Osabe.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that one enshrines Emperor Junnin, Imperial Prince Toneri and Imperial Prince Sawara, and the other enshrines Empress Jingu, Empress Inoue and Imperial Prince Osabe.
sen.cmt: changed comma to "that"; fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: It is said that one enshrines Emperor Junnin, Imperial Prince Toneri and Imperial Prince Sawara, and the other enshrines Empress Jingu, Empress Inoue and Imperial Prince Osabe.

sen.j: 一説に、仲恭天皇（九条廃帝）の陵で、神社は神霊を奉斉したものであるとも、あるいは舎人親王の墓であるとも、藤原実頼の墓であるともいう。
sen.e: According to a couple of theories, the knoll was a mausoleum of Emperor Chukyo (Dethroned Emperor Kujo) and the divine sprit was enshrined in the shrine, or a grave of Imperial Prince Toneri or FUJIWARA no Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 「陵」はknoll の部分を指すもの、ととらえてknoll を補いました。
sen.e: According to a couple of theories, the knoll was a mausoleum of Emperor Chukyo (Dethroned Emperor Kujo) and the divine spirit was enshrined in the shrine, or it was a grave of Imperial Prince Toneri or FUJIWARA no Sanetomo.

According to a couple of theories, the knoll was a mausoleum of Emperor Chukyo (Dethroned Emperor Kujo) and the divine spirit was enshrined in the shrine, or it was a grave of Imperial Prince Toneri or FUJIWARA no Sanetomo.

sen.j: 円墳について祀るから塚本社ともいった。
sen.e: It was also called Tsukamoto (barrow base) shrine since the round barrow was enshrined.
sen.cmt: 「円墳について祀る」の意味がやや不明で、またenshrineは他動詞のため、「円墳を祀る」と訳しました。
sen.e: It was also called Tsukamoto Shrine since the round burial mound was enshrined.
sen.cmt: changed "round barrow" to "round burial mound" for "円墳"; eliminated (barrow base) since it did not seem to help in understanding
sen.e: It was also called Tsukamoto Shrine since the round burial mound was enshrined.

sen.j: 明治10年1月京都市五条坂の若宮八幡神社に合祀された。
sen.e: January 1877, the divine spirit of Haitei no Yashiro shrine was enshrined together in the Wakamiya Hachiman-gu Shrine in Gojyo-zaka, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 神霊 "divine sprit"を補いました。
sen.e: In January of 1877, the diviine spirit of Haitei no Yashiro Shrine was enshrined together with the Hachiman-gu Shrine in Gojyo-zaka, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: added "In"; added "of" after "January"; added "with" after "together"; fixed spacing;
sen.e: In January of 1877, the divine spirit of Haitei no Yashiro Shrine was enshrined together with the Wakamiya Hachimangu-jinja Shrine in Gojo-zaka, Kyoto City.
